severity_assessment_rules.High: Active leakage or cracks that can impact durability/safety if unaddressed.
severity_assessment_rules.Medium: Moisture indicators or finish defects that may worsen and require remediation.

probable_root_cause_hypotheses.hypothesis: Bathroom waterproofing / tile joint failure allowing moisture ingress
evidence_basis: Presence of tile joint gaps in bathroom areas
Multiple moisture indicators observed in bathrooms (where reported)

probable_root_cause_hypotheses.hypothesis: Localized plumbing leakage contributing to moisture presence
External seepage through cracks or building envelope defects
evidence_basis: Efflorescence/dampness can be consistent with moisture migration (where reported)

Immediate: Investigate and repair the active leakage source immediately to prevent further damage.
Conduct structural assessment of reported cracks and carry out appropriate repair/remediation.
Short-term: Address dampness/efflorescence areas after identifying the moisture pathway; repair finishes after source control.
Re-grout and seal tile joints in affected wet areas to reduce water ingress.
Inspect plumbing lines and fittings in affected bathrooms; repair any defects found.
Verification: Perform moisture meter readings at affected walls (skirting zones, bathrooms, adjacent rooms) to quantify moisture extent.
If plumbing leakage is suspected, perform a plumbing pressure test to confirm.
Repeat thermal scan post-repair to confirm anomaly reduction (room-level mapping recommended).

thermal_analysis.interpretation: The thermal readings show a maximum hotspot of 28.8°C and a minimum coldspot of 20.1°C, indicating a temperature difference of 8.7°C across the inspected areas. This suggests moderate thermal variation, which may be normal depending on the environment and application.
thermal_analysis.constraint: Room-level mapping of thermal images is Not Available unless explicitly provided in the thermal report text.

missing_information: Room-level mapping of thermal images to specific inspected areas is Not Available.
Exact source of moisture (plumbing vs seepage vs condensation) is Not Available.
Depth and extent of moisture penetration is Not Available.
Confirmation via moisture meter or invasive testing is Not Available.
Construction details of walls, slabs, and waterproofing systems are Not Available.
Timing alignment between inspection observations and thermal imaging is Not Available.
consistency_check: Thermal data shows significant temperature variation, which is generally consistent with the moisture-related issues observed in the inspection report. However, room-level correlation is not available due to missing thermal image mapping.
